### Loading the libraries
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)
```

### Load the data and clean the names
```{r}
malaria <- read_csv("data/malaria.csv") %>% clean_names()
```
```{r}
names(malaria)
```

```{r}
head(malaria)
```

```{r}
malaria_long <- malaria %>% 
  pivot_longer(cols = starts_with("malaria_rdt"),
               names_to = "age_class",
               values_to = "cases") %>% 
  select(data_date, submitted_date, location_name, district, age_class, cases)
```


### Which district had the highest number of cases?
```{r}
malaria_long %>% 
  filter(data_date== "2020-07-30") %>% 
  group_by(district) %>% 
  summarise(tot_cases = sum(cases, na.rm = T)) %>% 
  arrange(-tot_cases)
#minus equals not total cases
```
